You are given a deck of $n$ cards with values $a_1, a_2, ..., a_n$ from top to bottom. Initially, only the top card is unlocked.

You can play the following game:

1. Choose an unlocked card. The value on the card is $v$.
2. Unlock the first $v$ locked cards from the top of the deck. If there are fewer than $v$ locked cards, unlock all the locked cards.
3. Earn $v$ victory points.
4. Remove the chosen card from the deck.

The game ends when all cards are locked or there are no cards left in the deck.

What is the maximum number of victory points you can earn?

You have a deck of cards with numbers on them.  The top card is always unlocked.  You can choose an unlocked card and either unlock the next few cards in the deck (up to the number on the card) or earn points equal to the number on the card.  You remove the card after using it.  What is the maximum number of points you can earn?
